newsitem.title: CANADA: St. Lawrence Seaway opens as ship enters east.
newsitem.headline: St. Lawrence Seaway opens as ship enters east.

text.p: The St. Lawrence Seaway opened its 39th navigation season at 1030 EST/1530 GMT as the ship, Algocape entered the St. Lambert lock at the east end of the 2,300-km link to the Great Lakes, a Seaway Authority statement said.
The Algocape, a bulk carrier operated by Algoma Central Marine, was carrying iron ore from Pointe-Noire, Quebec, to Indiana Harbor in the United States, it said.
"The healthy trade levels recorded last year should be maintained for iron ore, steel slabs and steel products, coal and other bulk," Seaway Authority president Glen Stewart said.
"The only cloud in the sky may be with the movements of Canadian and American grains which are always unpredictable," Stewart added.
The Seaway Authority completed a C$15 million maintenance project on both the Montreal-Lake Ontario and Welland Canal sections of the Seaway during the three-month winter shutdown.
The Port Weller Dry Docks were dredged and Bridge 20 was removed from the Welland Canal, the authority said.
"These improvements should reduce transit times through both areas," it said.
